answer:
The side effects of the flu vaccine are usually very minor, like soreness, redness, or swelling where the vaccine was given, or a mild fever. These effects will generally subside after a day or two. In addition to  putting a cool cloth on the arm where your child got the vaccine, pain medication is fine. You will find more information in the Health Passport on pages 16-17. For further questions or concerns, please contact your immunization provider.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## The side effects of the flu vaccine are usually very minor, like soreness, redness, or swelling where the vaccine was given, or a mild fever.

These effects will generally subside after a day or two.
In addition to  putting a cool cloth on the arm where your child got the vaccine, pain medication is fine.
You will find more information in the Health Passport on pages 16-17.
For further questions or concerns, please contact your immunization provider.
Immunization Nurse
question: My 5 year old child received her flu shot today, she was anxious and tensed up during the injection. She is complaining her arm hurts, can I give her Tylenol?
question_variation_0: can i give her tylenol flu shot
question_variation_1: what is flu shot for children today
question_variation_2: can i give my child tylenol
